title: Mastery 6 and 7 is just a lame excuse to use champion essence
body:
It doesn't make sense for it to work on an experience bar sort of system up until 5, then require weird random specific things to go to 6 and 7.  Being lucky enough to get a specific champion shard(or having enough other shards to dump into essence) has absolutely nothing to do with getting better at a champion.

Seems to me this was only done to shoehorn a way to use champion essence into the game just so it's there.

First: you can buy a random champion shard with IP.

Second: Veterans complained endlessly that there was no use for champion shards or blue essence for them. Riot said they'd make something. Riot made it. Now other players are complaining about it. Why do you need mastery 6 or 7? I think the token idea was really cool, and if you REALLY care about the mastery levels on a champion (e.g. because it's your main) then you can spend 1700 IP a few times (or less) for champion shards (and I got 20 blue essence with the one shard I bought) to rank up. It seems fine. Sure, it's another IP sink when I'm IP-poor (only 50-ish champions) but I'm only going to pursue higher mastery levels on a handful of champions so it's not a big deal.

Vet player here, hi, what's up.

This system is pretty damn awful in terms of IP-sinks. When people asked for an IP sink, they wanted a system that allows for players to use their IP for things of value. To be able to get cosmetics, trinkets and otherwise for a reduced but sink-value. 

This system, by comparison, is a tacked-on requirement to something that doesn't need anything tacked onto it. Remove the champ essence/IP thing and leave it as just combining tokens. Do you lose anything? Actually you probably gain something. It makes mastery more about skill-based stuff. 

Doubly so, the things that Riot -COULD- let you buy for IP are still locked behind RP barriers. If 3-5 icons are put on the store, only one will be available for IP. Chromas are RP only. You can't even buy crates/keys for large IP costs. There are hundreds of ways that you could allow for IP sinks and Riot chose one of, if not the, worst option.

I was just googling to see if there were some IP solutions to the terrible implementation of Masteries 6 and 7. I saw this post and logged in to downvote.

No one needs mastery 6 or 7. It's just a fun way to show your dedication to a champion you play. The same goes for all the other champion mastery tiers. It's just a little way to show how you've been playing. Riot decided to introduce 6 and 7 to show some level of skill or capability players have with champions. It's not necessarily about how much time you sink into any certain one.

Tying this to the goofy crafting system makes no sense at all. The crafting is supposed to be a fun way to get access to some things you may not have considered or wanted to invest in. Over time you can get some free skins or champs. The randomness of it keeps it interesting. Why on earth would this be tied to the mastery tiers requiring S ranked games?

It's like if Sally at work told your boss the office was kind of boring. He decides to give people more leeway with decorating their desks. Sally, you, and Jim are eligible for pay raises because of how well you perform in the work place. In the end, he only gives this Sally the raise because her desk has the most festive decorations. He tells you and Jim that he'll still consider the two of you for a raise, but first you need to put up a couple pictures, some flowers, and a few figurines around your desk.

Maybe it's not the hardest thing to do, and maybe you've got random junk lying around that can be used for the situation. It still makes absolutely no sense.
Yet, it's better than nothing.  Weird right?

I actually see this as not better than nothing.  If there was no way to use IP or essence, they'd still have to try to find a use for them.  As it is, they can ignore it because technically there's something for us to spend them on.
